intro: Selloa linearis, commonly known as the slender selloa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. Its linear, narrow leaves and small yellow flowers make it a distinctive species within its habitat. Selloa linearis is often found in regions with a temperate climate and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
